abstract: An association representing 300 large companies said a provision of the health overhaul would hurt profits.
snippet: An association representing 300 large companies said a provision of the health overhaul would hurt profits.
lead_paragraph: An association representing 300 large corporations urged President Obama and Congress on Monday to repeal a provision of the health care overhaul that prompted AT&T, Caterpillar and other companies to announce substantial charges for the current quarter.

headline.main: Companies Push to Repeal Provision of Health Law
headline.print_headline: In Tax Move, A Pushback On Reform

abstract: Lloyds Banking Group will keep Eric Daniels as its chief executive for at least another 12 months, The Financial Times reported. This despite the recent commencement by Sir Win Bischoff, the bank’s chairman, of an “emergency succession plan” for the C.E.O.’s role.
snippet: Lloyds Banking Group will keep Eric Daniels as its chief executive for at least another 12 months, The Financial Times reported. This despite the recent commencement by Sir Win Bischoff, the bank’s chairman, of an “emergency succession plan” for t...
lead_paragraph: The Lloyds Banking Group will keep Eric Daniels as its chief executive for at least another 12 months, The Financial Times reported. This statement comes despite the recent commencement by Sir Win Bischoff, the bank’s chairman, of an “emergency succession plan” for the C.E.O.’s role.

headline.main: Lloyds Chief Could Stay for Another Year

abstract: Time magazine gives Bank of America’s new chief, Brian T. Moynihan, high marks so far.
snippet: Time magazine gives Bank of America’s new chief, Brian T. Moynihan, high marks so far.
lead_paragraph: When Brian T. Moynihan agreed in December to step into the top spot at Bank of America, he had a challenge ahead of him: rebuilding Bank of America’s image after a year marred by a taxpayer bailout and lawsuits by shareholders unhappy with its acquisition of Merrill Lynch, not to mention the task of regaining the trust of clients and raising morale among its beleaguered bankers.

headline.main: Good Marks for Moyhihan at Bank of America

abstract: Microsoft, Google and other companies are pushing to protect private information from government access.
snippet: Microsoft, Google and other companies are pushing to protect private information from government access.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A broad coalition of technology companies, including AT&T, Google and Microsoft, and advocacy groups from across the political spectrum said Tuesday that it would push Congress to strengthen online privacy laws to protect private digital information from government access.

headline.main: Technology Coalition Seeks Stronger Privacy Laws
headline.print_headline: A Wide Call To Improve Web Privacy
